lexUnit.name: pronounce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make the sound of (a word or part of a word).

sentence.text: He pronounced it as two separate words , very deliberately .
He pronounced it ` Roobish " -- it was a word in which his Rummidge accent was particularly noticeable .
Okay so sometimes it helps if when you see a word you pronounce it to yourself .
For example , some words may be concatenated , such that certain sounds are omitted , e.g. " go away " may be pronounced as " go way " .
Lieberman ( 1963 ) , for example , found that speakers pronounce words less clearly when they are more predictable from their linguistic or pragmatic contexts .
She pronounced the names as if they were utterly outlandish .
Every time he heard the sacred name pronounced by this strange voice , Henri thrilled with joy ; it seemed to him like a voice from beyond the grave , something mysterious and superhuman .
All the adults pronounced the name of Balmoral with a unique excitement ; the cousins were soberly proud of their duty to play with the royal children .
Taking his cue from her , Thiercelin pronounced it German-style , with three syllables .
It is difficult for Spanish-speakers to pronounce the English sound ` ea " .
Similarly , adjacent sounds may be modified to sound more like each other , e.g. " gone back " may be pronounced as " gom back " .
Be careful that the words sound the way they do normally , because it 's very easy when you pronounce individual words to make them sound odd .
She pronounced it like Doktor with a ` k " .
Japlish words are pronounced as they would be written in katakana , a Japanese phonetic syllabary .
Obviously , single-syllable words present no problems -- if they are pronounced in isolation they are said with primary stress .
She pronounced the dog 's name with special contempt .
Consonants in possible trisyllabic words -- for example , can the child pronounce the ` l " in ` elephant " or the ` m " in ` umbrella " ?
She pronounces ` liver " with a long vowel , so that for a second he thinks she is asking if he likes geese saliva .
The mestizo pronounced them again and with care , proud of his command of the language .
That erm instead of saying ng they pronounced it as just N .
